page.title: 01THE COUNTRYSIDE SOUTH EAST
page.content: The area is rural, predominantly agricultural and woodland, and includes the village of Yatton Keynell and the hamlets of Ford, Slaughterford and Giddeahall. The farmland is mainly enclosed rough grazing and the fairly extensive woodland deciduous. The Castle Combe Circuit is an important Motor Racing venue. Apart from the farming community residents leave the area to work, in Bath, Chippenham or Bristol, for the most part. A major road the A20 crosses the southernmost squares from east to west, one B road crosses the grid area diagonally south east to north west, all other roads being of minor country lane standard for the most part. The western half of the block is included in the controlled area of outstanding natural beauty.
